Fix: The fix was to replace frappe.get_doc("Asset Category", asset_category) with frappe.get_cached_doc("Asset Category", asset_category)

title: fix: Create Sales Order from Quotation for Prospect (backport #42379)
body:
**Version:** dev and 15

fixes: #42136

**Before:**

- Suppose we create an opportunity for a prospect without a lead and then create a quotation from the opportunity, then the quotation will be created but when you create a sales order from the quotation, the lead error occurs. Because the opportunity is not connected to the lead. But sometimes it is also a case that when an opportunity is created for a direct prospect, this case fails.


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/04190f38-4be3-4258-a533-ce97e994da2f

**After:**

- When creating a sales order from a quotation for a prospect, if the prospect is not a customer, then first create a customer and then create a sales order.

title: feat: pseudo-translate fixtures created by setup wizard
body:
This PR achieves the following goals:

1. Names of fixture records need to be inserted in english because they are hardcoded in many places
2. Names of fixture records should get translated in the UI
3. Names of fixture records should get extracted as translatable strings

The combination of (1) and (3) is achieved by redefining the translation function to return the input unchanged (only for this file). Hence, the strings won't get translated but the extractor can still pick them up.

(2) is achieved by enabling "Translate Link Fields" for the respective DocTypes.

In `epnext/setup/setup_wizard/data/` we store some `.txt`-files with record names that are created by the setup wizard. The respective DocTypes have "Translate Link Fields" enabled. We need to extract these record names so people can translate them. Extraction is done by just splitting these `.txt`-files line by line, where each line becomes a translatable string.

title: fix: linkage between asset repair and asset value adjustment (backport #42719)
body:
This PR consist of following fixes:

1. **Asset Value Adjustment and Depreciation Recalculation After Asset Repair:**

- Issue: When an asset with existing depreciation undergoes an Asset Value Adjustment (increasing its value), followed by an Asset Repair, the system:

> - As expected cancels previous depreciation entries.
> - But recalculates the depreciation schedule using the initial asset value instead of the adjusted value.
> - Ignores already booked depreciation entries, recalculating based on the original depreciation period.

2. **Canceling Asset Repair or Asset Value Adjustment:**

- Issue: When canceling:
> - An Asset Repair, the system reverts to the initial asset value in the depreciation schedule, ignoring the adjusted value.
> - Similarly when cancelling an "Asset Value Adjustment", it just consider the asset value as given in the Current Asset Value field present in the form but ignores if value has been changed after that adjustment through asset repair.<hr>This is an automatic backport of pull request #42719 done by [Mergify](https://mergify.com).

title: fix: Force Fetching updates on Subscriptions (backport #42221)
body:
# Issue
Post [this](https://github.com/frappe/erpnext/pull/30963) refactor, `Fetch Subscription Updates` creates Invoices only if the Current Invoice Start / End date matches the current date. For old subscriptions, this also resets these values to the current periods' start and end dates without creating any pending invoices.

Consider the below subscription,

|||
|-|-|
|Subscription Start Date| 1st Jan|
|Subscription End Date|31 Dec|
|Plan Interval|1 Month|

and current date is 2nd March

When 'Fetch Subscription Updates' is triggered,
### Current behavior:
No Invoices are created for Jan and Feb and `current_invoice_start` and `current_invoice_end` date are updated to the latest month - March

### Expected behavior:
Invoice for January should be created and the `current_invoice_start` and `current_invoice_end` should be updated to February. Upon triggering 'Fetch Subscription Updated' again, the same should happen for February. Triggering it again, should not create any invoices as the current period - March, is not over.

# Fix
Adding a new Action button `Force-Fetch Subscription Updates`. This will have the expected behavior stated above, without allowing the scheduled job to create invoices for old subscriptions on its own.

![Screenshot from 2024-08-13 14-54-19](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f821adc0-af50-4529-95bb-73b923555d7e)

title: fix: linkage between asset repair and asset value adjustment
body:
This PR consist of following fixes:

1. **Asset Value Adjustment and Depreciation Recalculation After Asset Repair:**

- Issue: When an asset with existing depreciation undergoes an Asset Value Adjustment (increasing its value), followed by an Asset Repair, the system:

> - As expected cancels previous depreciation entries.
> - But recalculates the depreciation schedule using the initial asset value instead of the adjusted value.
> - Ignores already booked depreciation entries, recalculating based on the original depreciation period.

2. **Canceling Asset Repair or Asset Value Adjustment:**

- Issue: When canceling:
> - An Asset Repair, the system reverts to the initial asset value in the depreciation schedule, ignoring the adjusted value.
> - Similarly when cancelling an "Asset Value Adjustment", it just consider the asset value as given in the Current Asset Value field present in the form but ignores if value has been changed after that adjustment through asset repair.
